subject: Tool that shows which test(s) cover lines in class under test?
msgSnippet: I ve worked with jCoverage and Cobertura for the past several months. However, I d like to find a tool that will display, for each line of the class under
messageBody:
I've worked with jCoverage and Cobertura for the past several months.
However, I'd like to find a tool that will display, for each line of the
class under test, which unit tests actually executed that line. Simply
stating that X line was executed Y times is of marginal use to me if I
can't map back to see exactly /how/ that line was executed. I don't
recall whether EMMA does this. Any other suggestions? Commercial version
of jCoverage?

Why do I need this? At first, I created a custom Javadoc taglet that
developers would add to their class-under-test's method comments, to the
tune of:

/**
* @... = FooTest#testAddBar()
* @... = FooTest#testAddThreeBars()
*/
public void addBar(Bar bar) { ... }

This would insert appropriate Javadoc links to the relevant test
methods. But this is unwieldy, and certainly an unrealistic requirement
for the developers.
